    Useful tools for working & studying

    Others Collection Windows Linux

    👉 Useful tools for Data Science, Machine Learning.
    👉 Web Dev tools.

    This note will always be updated.

    Online tools #

    Images #

    1. Compress images: PNG, JPG.
    2. Remove background / Transparent photos: online png tools, lunapic.
    3. iloveimg: resize, crop, compress, rotate.
    4. Side by side images: this tool.
    5. Change color:
      • of a single color: onlinepngtools
      • all colors to a single different one: manytools
    6. Free photos:
      • Icon / Logo: vectorlogo (only marques), flaticon (a lot, be able to custom color)
      • Stocks: unsplash & pexels & pixabay (taken by photographers), freepik (with vector sources).
    7. Get link Google Photos
    8. Add border to png -> onlinephototools
    9. Convert to SVG

    Office #

    1. PDF tools:
      • Convert PDF to Word (conserve format): freepdfconverter.
      • PDF Editor online free: pdfescape
        • Edit text: sejda
        • Change metadata: bluepdf
        • View pdf's metadata: pdfyeah
    2. Etherpad -- a highly customizable Open Source online editor providing collaborative editing in really real-time.
    3. Text recognition (OCR): newocr
    4. LaTeX tools
      • Overleaf -- online LaTeX editor.
      • IguanaTex -- A Free LaTeX Add-In for PowerPoint on Windows
    5. Obsidian -- Obsidian is a powerful knowledge base that works on top of
      a local folder of plain text Markdown files.

    Multi-platforms #

    1. GitKraken -- git client for ubuntu (better than Github Desktop when importing local)
    2. GoldenDict -- dictionaries + its dictionaries.
    3. Google Play Music Desktop Player (support Youtube Music with custom controllers, online only).
    4. Jitsi Meet -- More secure, more flexible, and completely free video conferencing.
    5. Mailspring -- Email client.
    6. Typora -- WYSWYG markdown editor.
    7. VirtualBox -- virtual machine.
    8. XDM -- download manager.
    9. Download Youtube playlist
    10. ShareDrop -- P2P file transfer.

    Windows #

    1. Big Stretch Reminder -- free simple reminder tool that prompts a user to take regular breaks and helps prevent the symptoms of Repetitive Strain Injury (RSI).
    2. cmder (Console Emulator) -- (update 11/20: should use Windows Terminal with dropdown support) drop-down terminal for windows. My setting file.
    3. DeepL -- Quickly translate app (by using Ctrl + C + C).
    4. Everything -- an alternative to Spotlight in Mac. You can search any thing (app, docs, files,...) in your computer with hotkeys.
    5. FastStone Capture -- screen recorder.
    6. Lingoes -- dictionary (used alongside with GoldenDict) -- its dictionaries.
    7. LockHunter -- find what application/process is preventing us from deleting some folder/file.
    8. ScreenToGif -- screen recorder and auto convert to gif file.
    9. Unikey -- Vietnamese input method on Windows.

    Linux #

    1. Cheese (Appstore) -- webcam for linux.
    2. Foliate (Appstore) -- Book reader.
    3. gThumb (Appstore) -- photo viewer + quick editing tools.
    4. Guake Terminal -- drop-down terminal (more settings)
    5. Kazam (Appstore) -- Screen Recorder.
    6. Lotion -- Unofficial Notion client for linux (online only)
    7. Lutris -- playing games on linux.
    8. Notejot (Appstore) -- sticky note.
    9. OpenComic -- read offline comic with many supported files (zip, folder containing images,...)
    10. Rhythmbox (Appstore) -- Music player on Linux (custom hotkeys).
    11. Workrave -- a program that assists in the recovery and prevention of Repetitive Strain Injury (RSI).
    12. exfalso (Appstore) -- edit mp3 tag on linux.

    MacOS #

    1. iTerm2 -- drop-down terminal.
    2. Time Out -- a program that assists in the recovery and prevention of Repetitive Strain Injury (RSI).

    Education #

    1. Foreign language learning:
      • DeepL -- "better than google translate" app for Windows. You can use Ctrl + C + C to quickly translate a word or phrase.
      • GoldenDict -- global dictionary (multi-platform). Its dictionaries.
      • Lingoes -- Global dictionary for Windows. Its dictionaries.
      • QTranslate -- quickly translate any word / phrase and also their pronunciation by using hotkeys (for example, you can use Ctrl + E to hear the pronunciation and Ctrl + Q to see the translation). The data is obtained from various sources including deepl and google translate.
      • LyricsTraining -- a new way to learn English and other languages through music and the lyrics of your favourite songs.
      • PhimLearning -- watch movie and learning foreign language with bilanguage-subtitles.
      • Grammar & Spell check online: Scriben, Grammarly, 1checker.
    2. Raindrop -- bookmark to read later the articles (like Pocket)
    3. arXiv Vanity -- renders academic papers from arXiv as responsive web pages so you don’t have to squint at a PDF.
    4. b-ok -- download books (may be illigal).

    Math tools #

    1. Matcha -- draw / write LaTeX / Tikz online, very beautiful.
    2. WolframAlpha -- powerfully computational intelligence.
    3. Geogebra Graphhing Calculator -- draw graph online with Geogebra.
    4. Desmos -- advanced Graphing calculator.
    5. Sketchometry
    6. Diagram

    Chrome extension #

    1. AVIM -- Vietnamese input method
    2. Flash Video Downloader -- get any video download link.
    3. Hush -- private bookmarking
    4. Mate -- Quick translater.
    5. Print Friendly & PDF -- print any web page into pdf.
    6. TabCloud -- save current tab list

    Others #

    1. talentoday -- Empowering Growth for Individuals and Teams
